step_data.thought:
I'm now on the search results page showing issues related to 'image accessibility' in the a11yproject.com repository. Looking at the results, I can see several issues that appear to contain valuable information about making images accessible:

1. Issue #1507: 'Ensuring that your site conforms to Success Criteria 1.4.5 (Images of Text)'
2. Issue #917: 'Accessible Images When It Matters Most'
3. Issue #428: Contains information about ALT text for images (based on the snippet visible)
4. Issue #194: 'Article: How to create accessible sprites'
5. Issue #397: 'Background Images on Websites'

Among these, Issue #917 'Accessible Images When It Matters Most' seems particularly relevant to the goal of finding recommendations on making images accessible. The description mentions that it covers 'different types of images' and appears to be a comprehensive resource on image accessibility. I'll click on this issue to view its full content.
